primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God restores His presence to humanity through the work of Christ, transforming individuals into a collective temple (the Church) where they function as priests.

tekstueel_bewijs: God decided not to leave us in this. He planned to rescue a race of people.
God is present because of the work of Jesus Christ.

object.identificatie: The Presence of God (Restoration of face-to-face relationship)
tekstueel_bewijs: The entire storyline of the Bible in terms of one theme: the presence of God.
Seeing him and knowing him face-to-face.
Chosen by God and precious to him.
He planned to rescue a race of people.
Once you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.
God did not leave us to stew in our own juices.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of mercy who is then transformed into a Subject of the secondary program.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (The Cornerstone) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit comes into you.
As you come to him... you also, like living stones, are being built.
helper.rol_van_god: God is both the Subject (Initiator) and the Helper (Mediator in Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that enables the transformation of the 'stones'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Human Autonomy / The 'Brokenness' of the Fall
tekstueel_bewijs: We wanted to be our own masters.
We can’t bear the presence of God.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but an ontological inability to survive God's presence due to sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer (Subject) offers spiritual sacrifices (Object) to God, serving the city and the church.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (The Priesthood)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Spiritual Sacrifices / Ministry / Deeds of Love
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (Ethics/Ministry) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (Soteriology/Cornerstone).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God created us for his presence.
God decided not to leave us.
The glory of God has broken out into our lives.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You are being built into a spiritual house.
You should be part of the priesthood.

voorbeelden: You should be part of the priesthood.
Don’t you want to be part of that?
He has to be precious to you.
What does it all mean? Let’s break that down.
How we can be enabled and empowered.
There’s absolutely no end to the kind of power for change.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the 'ability' (Pouvoir) granted by the Spirit rather than the 'obligation' (Devoir) of the law.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Eden) to S2 (Fall/Exclusion), then to ~S2 (Mercy/Tabernacle), and finally back to S1 (Christ/Temple).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between God's holiness and human sin is resolved by Christ becoming the 'rejected stone' so that humans can be 'precious stones'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes that the presence of God would 'destroy' us without the mediation of Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon issues a strong call to action (ministry), it grounds this 'output' entirely in the 'input' of God's prior action in Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Input/Output' to sound like a transaction.
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you are only doing input... it's bad for you.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the primary actor in transformation.
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God did not leave us to stew in our own juices.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as the source of competence (Pouvoir).
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: As you come to him... you also... are being built.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Moses, Abraham, Jacob) are used to show the progression of redemptive history, not as moral templates to copy.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric reading: God's presence was episodic for them but permanent for us.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was rejected... because you were precious to him.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) to change and serve.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin makes the presence of God unbearable/destructive.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (The whole world becomes a temple).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the Primary Program, positioning the hearer as a Receiver who is transformed into a secondary Subject.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Vouloir (motivation) in the second half.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure the 'Pouvoir' (power) is linked to the Spirit's work even in the specific tasks of ministry.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly state that the Spirit gives the specific 'Savoir-faire' (wisdom) for the 'hands only you can hold'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Opponent' in the secondary program (why we don't serve) is attributed to 'timidity' or 'selfishness'.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Frame the resistance to ministry as a 'stumbling' over the Stone—a lingering desire for autonomy.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Connects the ethics section back to the 'rejected stone' motif.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grounding ecclesiology and lay-ministry in a Christocentric, redemptive-historical framework. It avoids moralism by making the 'vocation' a participation in what God is already doing.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Input/Output' metaphor; Greimas shows that this metaphor actually functions as a modal shift from Devoir to Pouvoir.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'priesthood'; Greimas explains how the 'priesthood' is a functional actant dependent on the 'Cornerstone' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch': Christ takes the role of the 'Rejected Stone' (Opponent's target) so the hearer can take the role of 'Living Stone' (Subject's helper).

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (died, was rejected, became flesh, mediates)
We/You (turned away, come to him, are built, offer sacrifices)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Input/Output' to prevent the secondary program from becoming a new law.
